paper_abstract: It is well known that the C*-algebra of an ordered pair of qubits is M-2 circle plus M-2. What about unordered pairs? We show in detail that M-3 circle plus C is the C*-algebra of an unordered pair of qubits. Then we use Schur-Weyl duality to characterize the C*-algebra of an unordered n-tuple of d-level quantum systems. Using some further elementary representation theory and number theory, we characterize the quantum cycles. We finish with a characterization of the von Neumann algebra for unordered words.
